title: After 2 years, Quinn's AA still awkaward and prematurely cancels
body:
Meanwhile in patch 5.13....

{{champion:245}} EVERY SECOND MATTERS: Ekko's attack frame slightly improved

Rito, why u hate {{champion:133}}  and Valor?

EDIT/ ADDITION:
Thanks you all for the positive responses!  I just thought it was funny how quickly they were to unnecessarily smooth out a newer champ's AA's, compared to a 2 year old champ that specifically relies on AA's and also gets a thread at least once a week asking for QoL fixes to said AA.  Rito even admitted themselves -

3/30/2015 Patch 5.6 notes "Quinn's problems don't begin and end with Vault..."

**EDIT** **08/05/2015**: Morde update: "Attack Frame improved, but no longer scales as well with Attack Speed (Attack Frame should feel more consistent across game time). "  **Yet quinn who is AA reliant still is untouched.**

_**Rito, Demacia Needs Heroes!  Demacia is counting on us.
-Sincerely, {{champion:133}} and Valor**_

> [{quoted}](name=gubigubi,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=kgamK45k,comment-id=000a,timestamp=2015-07-09T18:13:52.599+0000)
>
> Don't even have a Valor icon ): 
> no luv ):

replies.body: Maybe we complain long enough about Quinn being clunky they'll fix her. Maybe, but then again they didn't nerf Lee because of "community backlash" but completely ignored it over Veigar.
{{champion:37}}
You mean you *don't* enjoy canceling her AA's after they've been in the air for 5 seconds?
sort of like why Swain, a mage whose absolutely everything has to do with his single crow and flock of crows, throws fireballs as an auto attack
Hey! I like fireballs!
It's actually bird droppings.
I don't care what he throws, I rather they make it so last hitting isn't damn near impossible on him.
He should throw crows.
I just thing that fixing the tons of issues Quinn has is some kind of Taboo in Riot's balance team..

Don't even have a Valor icon ): 
no luv ):

Quinn is still really buggy.

Within 2 minutes I backflipped off a Blitzcrank, and some how teleported backwards into the enemy turret, and also after using my ult and deactivating it, my entire kit stopped worked aside from auto attacks. Both times ended with me dying.
So in other words Quinn is slightly less buggy than Syndra.
but they fix syndra bugs, quinns got her's for life.

No they only fixed some of the E bugs, all the rest including the R bug remain. Coincidentally the R bug was introduced during the patch that Quinn was released. It was reported in the PBE, never dealt with, and went onto live.

> [{quoted}](name=macromite,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=kgamK45k,comment-id=000000000000,timestamp=2015-07-09T15:47:47.917+0000)
>
> but they fix syndra bugs, quinns got her's for life.

They fix it.... after half a year. Still, Quinn deserves closure.
*release Azir

*Release* Azir

Notice that's past tense

**DISCLAIMER: to readers, I'm aware any buffs should require evaluation as far as parallel nerfing is concerned (as it is, I'm of the belief that she's currently, well balanced--barring some TLC & QoL adjustments/tweaks).**

The wind-up on her Harrier auto hurts my soul & it's far too easy to cancel, don't you think? You can literally take steps after it's gone off & it'll cancel/disappear mid-max range.

**Also, what do you think about giving Valor W "lingering vision on revealed enemy champions for X seconds," after the big reveal?**

If you think about it, Valor already loses the lingering vision mechanic from the form costing him Harrier marking.

**Additionally, what do you think about removing the actual Harrier mark bonus from Vault & simply having her fire off a Harrier'd auto as she flips back (besides the fact that this would be incredibly badass)?**

Vault applying a Harrier mark interferes with her passive Harrier, further gating its use-viability (which, we have enough of that already with the risk-reward of getting snagged with it) without potentially sacrificing a passively applied Harrier mark.

In other words, you can gimp yourself by giving up your passive Harrier to Vault (overwriting the passive in many instances) or gimp yourself by not Vaulting simply because you aren't sure how soon or effectively your passive Harrier will take effect.

**As well, what about re-prioritizing Harrier marking to: Large Monsters>Enemy Champions>Small Monsters>Large Minions>Small Minions?**

It really hurts her jungle-game & objective-capping capabilities having small monsters equal in priority... also, an enemy champion coming near can also spoil your ability to cap that large monster you were working on--I think it best to put Large Monsters ahead of Enemy Champions for this reason... however, those two could work in reverse, looking at the alternative paradigm (counter-jungling/chunking away a pesky enemy Champion who's trying to get all up on your biznass)... making them equal in priority may do but I despise the random-factor.

**Lastly, how about something visual to indicate when a Large Monster or Enemy Champion is within range to be detected/marked by Harrier?**

Since her range is low, you want to be as far as possible a lot of the time... but that's very ineffective, as skirting that line can cost you the champion mark; it's just too fickle as-is. This would also present an opportunity to give her a tiny, lil bit more particle flavah. A tiny arrow or chit over-head an enemy champion or mark around their hit-box.

Thanks for the consideration & *hopeful,* ensuing chat!!

Sincerely,

Eyrgos

**P.S. TY so much for the changes in 5.6!!! They're incredible, a huge step in the right direction!! I just feel there's more to be done :), do you agree?**

> [{quoted}](name=Saixos Yewark,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=k1Et7oHA,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2015-03-26T23:16:28.225+0000)
>
> Quinns autoattack has got to be one of the most complained things about Quinn, it's horrible and a nightmare and should definitely be changed. I'd compare it to Karthus' old animation.

Yeah, it's plain awful; glad we see eye-to-eye here!

> [{quoted}](name=Saixos Yewark,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=k1Et7oHA,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2015-03-26T23:16:28.225+0000)
> 
> I think the lingering vision is an unnecessary buff, the main reason for the w is its passive and not its active. 

It is unnecessary, I don't disagree with you there. The reason I want it is because thematically, it fits perfectly... really immerses that 'bird of prey' aspect of being Valor. As well, it just feels odd that Valor W is the only Valor spell with no add'l functionality. Not only that, it removes functionality (unable to obtain lingering vision via the inability to passively Harrier mark, unlike Quinn).

> [{quoted}](name=Saixos Yewark,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=k1Et7oHA,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2015-03-26T23:16:28.225+0000)
> 
> This would basically make vault an autoattack reset, and it would be a pretty huge Quinn buff. Quinn kind of dances the line between not being viable and being overpowered mainly due to her bugs and small issues, and I think that this would push her over the edge. Plus I think it's a pretty cool part of playing Quinn to keep track of when your harrier applies to prevent interferences.

Missing the boat here, silly! Vault was already given an auto-attack reset on Vault the other day: http://www.reignofgaming.net/news/31081-patch-5-6-notes

"[NEW] GOT THE RESET Now resets Quinn's basic attack timer upon landing."

So, the idea is just to make it less fickle/more reliable & infinitely more awesome... especially since it already does this now lol. Also, I agree with you about her dancing that fine line--please read in the disclaimer that I believe she's very well balanced barring bugs/clunkiness.

> [{quoted}](name=Saixos Yewark,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=k1Et7oHA,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2015-03-26T23:16:28.225+0000)
> 
> I kind of agree with this, the random factor is pretty stupid. But I kind of don't agree with the list you've put up. The way I would do it is simply to give priority to the target Quinn has autoattacked last. 

Might I ask why you disagree? I'm just curious, it'll be helpful to obtain that sort of feedback/thought-process. I feel like giving priority to the last target hit could cause way more frustration than good... for instance, say you want to harass someone off Baron before they get too close to steal the final hit but then you want to return to last-hit Baron, only to have procced your Harrier mark onto that pesky enemy champion. Or say you're in a team fight & the enemy tank is bullying you but your top-priority is actually their assassin... you try to push off the enemy tank & then re-focus the assassin, only to have wasted your mark onto the tank. It just seems, hypothetically, far more irritating/nerve-racking than healthy or good for her gameplay-wise.

> [{quoted}](name=Saixos Yewark,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=k1Et7oHA,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2015-03-26T23:16:28.225+0000)
> 
> Finally, her harrier targeting range is the same as her autoattack range. If you can hit it it can be targeted.

I'm aware of this yet but like I mentioned... I skirt that line often & don't want to sacrifice a detection on an enemy champion merely because I stepped out of auto-range for .001 of a second & now it targets a lesser creep instead. Perhaps a countdown on the passive to when it'll apply next would be the best solution (the current cool-down timer doesn't count as Harrier marking doesn't always occur immediately after, even if within range the entire time awaiting it... maybe changing it to where it's guaranteed to pop the moment it comes off CD would be a good direction... you'd know to get into range or the very next time you did that it would occur immediately), so then you know when to weave back within range. Or else (perhaps in addition to), it'd be interesting if her detection were a little beyond her natural AA range & her Harrier auto's actually had bonus range... this would also further help to guarantee landing a Vault follow-up Harrier AA. It's just a thought, not necessarily saying it's the right way to go but it's intriguing to explore, to say the least.

In any case, thank you for the fine critique & good-natured reply!

I hope we get to discuss more & that Meddler stops by!!

Hey, thanks for the comment, seems like you've given this some thought.  IMHO, I don't want Quinn to be buffed or reworked (although the experimental PBE leak they had has me intrigued, but that's something for a different discussion).  I feel she's decently balanced, it's just her awkward AA as a marksmen and other QoL things that need addressed.  I don't want her to be too popular and turn into another jinx or kalista.

I would say no to the lingering vision, maybe a slight cool down decrease at most.  The power to give instant sight around you is so deceptively powerful enough.  I laugh when people think running into a bush will save them.

An auto AA mid Vault would be op. It would be like EZ applying an auto AA when he blinked in, sure they are different abilites, but they are close enough in comparison. Vault is allowed to be powerful because you give up your escape, and have to spend that extra second to stop and dedicate an AA.  

I agree about monster prioritization being tweaked.  I jungle Quinn and Valor often and it annoys me that I have to waste my passive damage on a small monster when I would rather use my blind aoE damage to kill small monsters.

Making her Passive detection slightly larger than AA would be nice, and I myself have mentioned giving her bonus range on passive marked champs, but I'm afraid that they would have to reduce the damage on the passive to compensate for the extra range.  

good points though, and I wish this could be the discussion where they finally acknowledge that Quinn needs some TLC.  Where is a Meddler when you need one?
Her passive makes the autos even worse...
yeah,  I can't count how many times i saw my AA bolt actually hit a minion, made a sound, but not actually apply the AA because I didnt let it finish the terrible animation.
Yea I really wish they'd make it a bit smoother, rito plz.
I can cancel autos on any adc and have the projectile fly but not do damage. Not seeing your problem.
On other ADCs, you do it willingly and knowingly. On Quinn, however, it happens randomly.
nah, it happens when ur bad at orb walking.
Yea it does....
Sometimes that happens, i think its client sided...
Not just that, but why does Valor not get his own champ pic on the boards?  He gets one in game.  The shit, Rito?  It's like you really _don't_ care.

Thanks you all for the positive responses!  I just thought it was funny how quickly they were to unnecessarily smooth out a newer champ's AA's, compared to a 2 year old champ that specifically relies on AA's and gets a thread at least once a week asking for QoL fixes to said AA.  Rito even admitted themselves -

3/30/2015 Patch 5.6 notes "Quinn's problems don't begin and end with Vault..."

_**Rito, Demacia Needs Heroes!  Demacia is counting on us.
-Sincerely, {{champion:133}} and Valor**_

I'll add this to the OP

I'd like to know the same thing. Also, if she launches her Q right before dying, the projectile disappears. This sort of thing doesn't happen with other Champions such as Gnar. She really needs to be looked at
It happens to talon. Rake won't come back to him if he dies.
thats bullshit. if it comes back to sivir or ahri then it should come back to talon too. i think it also happens with draven's ult
Depends on the attack. Talon's Rake and Draven's ult don't come back if they die.
Hate that, about to get a kill and i die...
bump
Meddler, where are you man.

Quinn is just an awkward champion to play.

Sure, if you end up getting fed, then you think OMG WHY DOES NO ONE MAIN HER

Then reality hits and you realize you can't carry with a champion who talks to birds.

> [{quoted}](name=Kawaii Lex,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=kgamK45k,comment-id=0010,timestamp=2015-07-09T23:19:13.139+0000)

> 
> Sure, if you end up getting fed, then you think OMG WHY DOES NO ONE MAIN HER

> Then reality hits and you realize you can't carry with a champion who talks to birds.

I play Queen in rank and had feeder who completelly gave up on game as well as 3 out of 5 players constantly try to surrender. Ashe, adc on another team was also doing really well. She was 17-8-12 and enemy team was up by 20 kills. Carry that game 26-9-18, had 60% of kills for my team. Its one of the ADCs who can actually CARRY!
Patch 5.14 notes are out and there is still no news of an AA animation fix for Quinn. This sucks.

Yeah, and it's not they will ever see these posts anyways.  Every patch brings with it a weeks worth of people complaining about this or that.  Last patch was "omg X  champ is op with sated devourer".  This patch its "omg new fiora sucks/ is good".  you get those posts piling on top of each other and they bury threads like these.
I suspect they must have seen at least one of these threads. Not that balancing other Champions and items isn't important, but Quinn's fixes are long overdue I think.

Bumb
and fk u Rito u lazy

This is one of the most irritating things about playing Quinn right now. One second you're clicking on a Harrier-Marked target, and ....

Your crossbow bolts fade into the aether even after popping your passive. No damage delt, and leaving you swearing you didn't stutterstep to your less-then-impressed support. 

Rito plz.
You have to maintain vision on your bolts until they hit the enemy, otherwise they just wink out of existence. Just like in real life.
Why the hate? :(
Because at the end of the day, she still has the most kills on your team.
